body:
What does `sys.getfilesystemencoding()` return? Also, what version of IPython are you using?

@jstenar Can you have a shot at replicating this?

Using sys.getfilesystemencoding() returns this: mbcs

The version is 0.13 for windows 32

I could not replicate this problem with an account name of Gäst, giving 
a home directory of C:\Users\Gäst

Using an account with greek letters in the account name, then I get a 
warning about not being able to create the profile in the 
C:\Users<greek> and instead using a temp dir but everything starts and 
I can serve notebooks from my homedir.

A preliminary investigation shows that when calling os.path.abspath and 
os.path.realpath with a str then greekletters will be replaced by ?. 
This happens for instance when calling os.path.abspath(".") when current 
dir is homedir. It looks like get_ipython_dir and possibly other 
functions in utils.path are susceptible to this problem.

@minrk Spent some time improving unicode support on Windows. It should now work for characters that can be encoded with the current code page. Other unicode characters will cause problems on Python 2, but you can use it with Python 3.
